lines.text: Well, I'm a very considerate man. My mother taught me that.
[Samuel laughs]
Now, what the hell you laughing about? You don't think I'm considerate?
I don't believe you had a mother.
[Samuel hands John a letter from his wife]
You like her?
Very much.
I don't like any of mine.
Remember this... even the most impossible parts of this story really happened.
Have you ever failed?
Only at life.
You know, I also have killed a lion.
How many shots did you need?
I used my hands.
You don't enjoy killing, do you?
[Remington ignores the question by taking a swig from his flask]
Then why do it?
Because I've got a gift.
I wouldn't have thought bravery would be a problem for you.
Well, you hope each time it won't be... But you never really know.
Mzee! John! Where do you think you're going?

[John cocks his rifle]
I'm going to sort it out.
[He fires a shot]
I'm going...
[He fires again]
to sort it out.
[He shoots into the air, again, walks onto the bridge, and continues firing]
"Everyone has a plan until they've been hit." Well my friend, you've just been hit. The getting up is up to you.

Well then you go too, you lack the courage to lead. Go! Tell all your men to go. But I will kill the lions and I will build the bridge. And you? You must go home and tell the wives of the men who died here that you fled with the others because you could not master your fear.
[last lines]
If you want to see the lions today, you must go to America. They are at the Field Museum in Chicago, Illinois. Even now, if you dare lock eyes with them, you *will* be afraid.
I will sort this out. I will kill the lion, and I will build he bridge.
Of course you will.
[as he walks away]
You're white, you can do anything.

[gun to his head]
I am a man of peace!
You sound like a man who wants to live.

[melancholy]
My life was shaped because someone invented gunpowder, and that's what took me around the world. But the memory that I wanted, that was the family that I lost.
You know Charles, you're a rather cheerful fellow when you get to know you.
[all start laughing]
Patterson the lion killer. I do wish I had been here for the hunt.
No, you don't.
Well, we all worked together. Worthy deeds were accomplished.
Oh, you're right. The devil has come to Tsavo. Look at me! I am the devil.
[after they discover the Lion's Den filled with skeletons, and are terrified]
Lions don't do this. Lions... never had a lair like this. They're doing it for the pleasure.
They'll know we've been here.
Darling... you know how God invented liquor so the Irish wouldn't rule the world. Well, I think he may have invented being stubborn so we can be the best at something.
What better job in all the world than build a bridge? Bring land over water. Bring worlds together.
I'm a monster. My only pleasure is tormenting those people who work for me.
You build bridges, John. You have to go where the rivers are.
I don't care about the thirty dead. I care about my knighthood.
The females of the species are larger. All the animals here are like that. they have to be to survive.
Their suffering is merely transitory. It ends once they accept God into their hearts.
[first lines]
This is the most famous and true African adventure.
I've made you with this assignment, don't make me break you.
You won't have the opportunity. Any other words of encouragement?
David Hawthorne. I'm um, this is my hospital. And my advice to you is, don't get sick.
